meanings.definition: A person who talks too much or too loudly, especially in a boastful or opinionated manner.
meanings.sent1: The bigmouths in the classroom always had something to say.
meanings.sent2: The group of bigmouths at the party dominated the conversation.
meanings.sent3: The bigmouths at the library were louder than the books!
meanings.sent4: Her bigmouths were like a trumpet announcing her every thought.
meanings.sent5: The bigmouths in the office were as noisy as a flock of birds.

meanings.definition: To speak in a boastful or opinionated manner.
meanings.sent1: He bigmouths about his achievements all the time.
meanings.sent2: She always bigmouths when she wants attention.
meanings.sent3: The cat bigmouths loudly when it wants to be fed.
meanings.sent4: The engine bigmouths its power as it revs up.
meanings.sent5: The wind bigmouths through the trees on stormy nights.
